content:
Low-impact exercises, such as cycling, can be just as effective as running for weight loss. Both types of exercise increase your heart rate, burn calories, and can lead to a calorie deficit, which is necessary for weight loss. However, the rate at which you burn calories may be different. Running is a higher-intensity exercise that generally burns more calories per minute than cycling, but the total number of calories burned depends on factors such as your body weight, the intensity, and duration of the exercise.

In addition to burning calories, cycling can also improve your muscle strength, endurance, and joint stability. Since cycling is a low-impact exercise, it may be a more sustainable option for individuals with joint problems or those who are new to exercise. Overall, the best exercise for weight loss is one that you enjoy and can stick to consistently over time, so choose the one that you feel the most comfortable with and fits into your lifestyle.
